title: Louisiana Tech dominates Blue Raiders
text:
Smyrna football can claim first with win over Oakland Tom Kreager, tkreager@dnj.com 3:30 p.m. CDT October 24, 2015 Buy Photo Smyrna's Jordan Jones (14) and Casey Perkins (5) celebrate Perkins' touchdown during their 21-14 win over Riverdale. Smyrna can claim the top seed in Region 2-6A with a win over Oakland on Friday. (Photo: HELEN COMER/DNJ) Buy Photo 20 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MURFREESBORO — Smyrna snapped a nearly four-year losing streak to Murfreesboro football programs earlier this year. 
If the Bulldogs can claim their third win over a 'Boro program this season, they can claim a share of the Region 2-6A title and earn the top seed from the league due to TSSAA's tiebreakers. 
Second-ranked Oakland (8-1 overall, 6-0 in 2-6A) finishes the regular season Friday at 10th-ranked Smyrna (7-2, 5-1) in a game to determine the region title. 
Oakland currently has a one-game lead over both Blackman (7-2, 5-1) and Smyrna. However, a Smyrna win would create either a two-way or three-way tie depending on what the Blaze do in their finale. Blackman plays at Warren County (1-8, 0-6). 
Smyrna would be the top seed over Oakland due to a head-to-head win if the Pioneers upset Blackman. If Smyrna and Blackman win, Smyrna would be first because its opponents will finish with more wins than either Oakland and Blackman, which is the TSSAA's fourth tiebreaker in determining playoff order. If Smyrna wins, Oakland is second and Blackman is third regardless of what the Blaze do Saturday. 
"If we want the No. 1 seed, we have to win," Oakland coach Kevin Creasy said. "We understand what we are play for. It should be a great game." 
Creasy said he hadn't looked at the playoff seeding scenarios prior to Saturday morning. 
"It goes to that fourth tiebreaker," 
If Smyrna and Blackman win, the three teams would tie in the first three categories — greatest number of victories, team that played most teams that won 50 percent or more of their games and team with the most wins over teams winning 50 percent or more of their games. 
Smyrna's opponents currently have three more overall wins than Blackman and Oakland, and neither can make that up in the final week. 
"Our goal was a region championship at the first of the year," said Smyrna coach Matt Williams after the Bulldogs' 21-14 win over Riverdale Friday night. "That opportunity is still there." 
Slot four through seven also have not yet been determined for 2-6A. 
The Cookeville-Riverdale winner will be fourth with the loser being fifth. 
The Coffee County-Siegel winner will be sixth with the loser being seventh. 
Warren County is eighth. 
All 32 teams in Class 6A are automatically in the playoffs. 
Also not yet determined is Region 5-5A, where three teams have a spot for two playoff berths. 
Independence will be the top seed from 5-5A. La Vergne has locked up a playoff berth, but could be anywhere from the second seed through the fourth depending on the Week 11 outcomes. 
Stewarts Creek (6-3, 4-2), Lincoln County (6-3, 3-3) and Shelbyville (6-3, 3-3) are all fighting for the remaining two spots. A Stewarts Creek win over Lincoln County or a Shelbyville loss to Franklin County (3-6. 2-4) guarantees Creek its first playoff appearance. 
However, if Creek loses to Lincoln County, La Vergne loses to Independence and Shelbyville wins against Franklin County, the Red Hawks would be out of the playoffs. 
"We control where we are going to fall," Stewarts Creek David Martin said. "We're in control of it. 
"It's fun to be relevant. It's nice to be in the talk for the playoffs. We are relevant in what is going on." 
Eagleville also remains in the playoff hunt. The Eagleville-Community winner will be the fourth seed from Region 4-2A. MTCS was eliminated from the 1A playoffs with its loss to Nashville Christian. 
Reach Tom Kreager at 615-278-5168 and on Twitter @Kreager. 
Week 11 Schedule 
(All games 7 p.m., Friday) 
Oakland at Smyrna* 
Lincoln Co. at Stewarts Creek 
Community at Eagleville 
Coffee Co. at Siegel, 7 p.m. 
Blackman at Warren Co., 
Cannon Co. at DeKalb Co.**
